newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent ends lower amid pre-holiday squaring.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent ends lower amid pre-holiday squaring.

text.p: IPE Brent futures closed lower on on Friday as the bears and the bulls battled it out around the key $20 level on the front month July contract, traders said.
July Brent settled 18 cents lower, bang on $20 a barrel level deemed crucial support. June gas oil closed earlier $1.25 lower at $177.75 a tonne.
Traders attributed the losses to moderate profit-taking and position squaring ahead of the long weekend on both sides of the Atlantic.
"There was a bit of a tug of war going on," said one trader. "First they pushed it down, but it got back up again. I think the whole thing has got a bit more of a bearish tone about it."
Traders said Brent futures had also been tracking the erratic path of NYMEX futures which were being batted about by the expiry of product options on Friday.
NYMEX July crude was trading 30 cents lower at $21.56 a barrel at 1944 GMT, while gasoline was a 0.13 cent off at 66.80 cents.
Both the IPE and NYMEX are shut are Monday due to the Memorial Day holiday in the United States and the Spring Bank Holiday in Britain. -- Melanie Goodfellow, London Newsroom, +44 171 542 7714.
